item.title: About
item.description: This is the website and personal blog of Mark Kevin Baltazar. Contents are mostly about programming.

item.title: How to Recover Password from a Saved Connection in DBeaver
item.description: Requirements OpenSSL is installed on your system OpenSSL is registered to PATH TLDR; cd credentials_config_json_directory # change this to the directory where credentials-config.json is located on your system openssl aes-128-cbc -d -K babb4a9f774ab853c96c2d653dfe544a -iv 00000000000000000000000000000000 -in "credentials-config.json" Export DBeaver Project DBeaver stores an encrypted credentials of your saved connections in the a file named “credentials-config.json”. To get this file we need to: In DBeaver, Go to File -> Export -> DBeaver -> Project Select an output directory Press Finish Go to output directory Rename output file and change extension to .
